about_the_game:
Beacon Patrol: First Horizons is a relaxing strategy game with endless possiblities.

Steer your Coast Guard ship and build your own coastal map one tile at a time.

Get more tiles by exploring and keep building indefinitely as long as you can keep scoring.


Start with your ship at the Coast Guard HQ and you build your map from there.

On your turn you place up to three tiles, connecting to the tile your ship currently occupies. Tiles must not be rotated and all their edges have to match.

After placing a tile you immediately move your ship onto it. By spending one of your tokens you can take an additional movement to a connected tile.

You score points for each tile that is connected to other tiles on all four sides. For scored points you receive new tiles to continue your journey.

The game ends after allavaialble tiles have been played.


Beacon Patrol: First Horizons combines the look and feel of a board game with the endless posibilities of a digital experience.

Experience this cozy and strategic game at any time.

The clear and cute art style lets you enjoy the coast and the sea from where ever you are.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 20.4, Ubuntu 18.04 or CentOS 7
  • Processor: 1Ghz Intel or AMD (x86) Processor with SSE2
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 3.2+
  • Storage: 300 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: If you have issues running the game, please contact us. We have some Linux knowledge, but not many test devices.

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: High Sierra 10.13 or newer
  • Processor: Intel or Apple Silicon Processor
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel, nVidia or AMD
  • Storage: 300 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: Any Mac or Macbook from 2012 should be able to play the game
